alert.note: Alert for Stewart; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 04 at 3:50AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Stewart and Webster Counties through 415 AM EST... At 350 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was near Sanford, or near Lumpkin, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Preston, Richland, Weston, Troutman, Kimbrough, Sanford, Westville, Church Hill, Centerpoint and Leveretts. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
